page.title: 11LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content:
Many local traditions survive from the past. The{Sowerby Bridge Morris}are frequently seen performing traditional local dances at many events.
At the annual{Rushbearing}a decorated cart, specially made by local craftsmen, and accompanied by a local band, carries a maiden and sheaves of rushes in procession along the Ryburn Valley to Saint Bartholomew's Church in Ripponden. The cart is met by the local clergy and prayers are said for the harvest and crops to come.
Other traditions are more modern. In Barkisland the local{drama group} organises a{pantomime,}involving many children and adults from the village. Performances are given to packed audiences for three days in February.
